news_header: President Trump has appealed to the US Supreme Court to fire the head of an independent ethics agency that protects whistleblowers. This case is significant as it is the first related to Trump's executive actions to reach the Supreme Court.
news_original_title: Trump appeals to Supreme Court over firing of US agency boss
news_text: The head of the agency, Hampton Dellinger, was fired by email and is suing the Trump administration for unlawful dismissal. A federal judge temporarily allowed Dellinger to keep his position, stating the firing violated US law. The Trump administration has faced multiple lawsuits regarding various policies, and efforts to reshape the federal workforce continue, with thousands of employees being terminated.
